info.description: API endpoints for managing cloud servers on Arvancloud infrastructure
info.title: Arvancloud IaaS API

get.description: Returns count of servers for each region
Returns info about server clusters for each region

post.description: Allocates one or more dedicated servers deduces their price from account's wallet

parameters.description: the info about requested dedicated server
parameters.name: AllocateDedicatedServerRequest

schema.description: the info about requested dedicated server

404.description: one or more resource IDs are not found

get.description: Returns info about dedicated server types and their plan pricing
get dedicated server pricing info based on allocation parameters

parameters.description: specifies whether auto-recovery feature is enabled
parameters.name: autoRecovery

schema.description: specifies whether auto-recovery feature is enabled

post.description: Releases one or more dedicated servers by their ID

parameters.description: IDs of the servers to be released
parameters.name: ReleaseDedicatedServerRequest

schema.description: IDs of the servers to be released

404.description: one or more resource IDs are not found

get.description: Returns a list of account's server clusters

post.description: Creates an empty dedicated server cluster

parameters.description: details of the server cluster to be created
parameters.name: CreateServerClusterRequest

schema.description: details of the server cluster to be created

404.description: one or more resource IDs are not found

delete.description: Deletes an empty dedicated server cluster

parameters.description: ID of the server cluster to delete
parameters.name: id

schema.description: ID of the server cluster to delete

parameters.description: ID of the server cluster to rename
parameters.name: id

schema.description: ID of the server cluster to rename

400.description: name is too long or not valid

get.description: Returns a list of dedicated servers along with their info
Returns a dedicated server details

patch.description: Change Auto Renewal of a dedicated server
Returns a list of dedicated servers along with their info

post.description: Renew a dedicated server

get.description: Returns all floating-ips

post.description: Creates a new floating-ip

parameters.description: Info about the new float-ip to be created
parameters.name: CreateFloatIPRequest

schema.description: Info about the new float-ip to be created

patch.description: Attaches a floating-ip to a server port

404.description: One or more resources not found

patch.description: Detaches a floating-ip from a server port

404.description: One or more resources not found

get.description: Returns info about the IPs of the attachments to server ports
Returns all user's images

post.description: Upload an image to user's personal images. Currently only supporting TUS. See https://tus.io

parameters.description: version of TUS that is used
parameters.name: tus-resumable

schema.description: version of TUS that is used

parameters.description: The size of entire file in bytes
parameters.name: upload-length

schema.description: The size of entire file in bytes

parameters.description: id of the image to be deleted
parameters.name: id

schema.description: id of the image to be deleted

patch.description: Append bytes to existing image, this is done by TUS. See https://tus.io

post.description: Download image from given URL
Request dedicated IP advertising

400.description: Either equest data is invalid or another request is made in last 72 hours

get.description: Returns the status of the last valid IP advertising request, or null object if no previous request was submitted
Get all user's networks

patch.description: Attach specified network to a server

parameters.description: id of the server which needs to be detached
parameters.name: AttachServerToNetworkRequest

schema.description: id of the server which needs to be detached

403.description: server can't be connected to a public network

404.description: one or more resources not found

parameters.description: id of the server which needs to be detached
parameters.name: DetachNetworkFromServerRequest

schema.description: id of the server which needs to be detached

get.description: Returns all instance ports

delete.description: Delete an instance port, this deallocates its public IP address as well

patch.description: Disable a port, which disables its interface in the attached server
Disable port security on given port. If disabled, security groups can't be assigned to this port

403.description: can't disable port security for external networks

patch.description: Enable a port, this enables its interface in the attached server
Enables port security on a port

403.description: can't disable port security for external networks

post.description: Creates a PTR record on an IP

parameters.description: IP and domain info of the PTR record
parameters.name: CreatePTRRequest

schema.description: IP and domain info of the PTR record

delete.description: Deletes a PTR record pointing to the specified ip address

parameters.description: the IP which PTR record points to
parameters.name: ip

schema.description: the IP which PTR record points to

get.description: Returns the limit of resources the user can allocate
Returns usage reports of a specific server
Returns metrics for a report

parameters.description: the metric name to be returned
parameters.name: metric

schema.description: the metric name to be returned

post.description: Creates a security group

parameters.description: Info about the security group to be created
parameters.name: CreateSecurityGroupRequest

schema.description: Info about the security group to be created

400.description: Description or name exceeded their character limit

post.description: Creates a rule for the specified security group
Creates a security group based on Arvan CDN. This allows CDN IPs in security rules of newly created group

get.description: Returns rules for a security group
Lists all user's server groups in specified region

post.description: Creates a server group in specified region

get.description: Lists all user's servers in specified region

post.description: Creates a server in specified region

parameters.description: specifies whether the request should be fulfilled asynchronously, if true, a non-empty task_id will be returned for server creation task
parameters.name: Async

schema.description: specifies whether the request should be fulfilled asynchronously, if true, a non-empty task_id will be returned for server creation task

get.description: Get a server details by its ID

parameters.description: Force delete server. If true, the server will be forcibly deleted
parameters.name: forceDelete

schema.description: Force delete server. If true, the server will be forcibly deleted

parameters.description: The reason why this server is being deleted
parameters.name: DeleteServerReasons

schema.description: The reason why this server is being deleted

get.description: Returns a list of actions which are permitted to be applied on the server

post.description: Add a new public ip to the server

parameters.description: security groups to be applied to newly added public ip
parameters.name: AddServerPublicIPRequest

schema.description: security groups to be applied to newly added public ip

post.description: Attach a security group(firewall) to the server

put.description: Attaches a volume to a server as its root volume. In order to do this, the volume MUST be bootable and detached

parameters.description: volume id to be attached as root
parameters.name: AttachServerRootVolumeRequest

schema.description: volume id to be attached as root

put.description: Detaches server root volume. The server MUST be turned off in order to be detached from its root volume

post.description: Restart server, this operation might cause data loss
Enables HA(Esfandiar eyes) Feature on server. This makes sure that servers are not affected from compute failures

parameters.description: action on the feature, either `enable` or `disable`
parameters.name: action

schema.description: action on the feature, either `enable` or `disable`

post.description: Power-Off the specified server

404.description: server or region is not found

post.description: Turns on the specified server

404.description: server or region is not found

419.description: currently the server cannot be turned on, this only happens when server is terminated

post.description: Reboot server gracefully
Rebuild server based on a new image

parameters.description: image info for the newly built server
parameters.name: RebuildImageRequest

schema.description: image info for the newly built server

post.description: Detaches a server from its security group(firewall)
Change server's display name
Restart server and boot into rescue mode
Reset linux based server's root password

404.description: server or region is not found

post.description: Change server's flavor

put.description: Resizes server root volume without changing its flavor

post.description: Makes a snapshot from server's root volume
Restart server from rescue mode into normal mode

get.description: Returns a noVNC url which can be used to interact with server
Get all delete reasons for server deletion. The response ids will be used in server deletion API endpoint

post.description: Discards a server creation task, removing it from server list, the task state must be in `ERROR` state

get.description: Add a new public ip to the server
Returns info about the server creation options in the specified region
Returns info about a region's available plans

parameters.description: filters based on cpu core count if exists
parameters.name: cpu

schema.description: filters based on cpu core count if exists

parameters.description: filters based on RAM MB if exists
parameters.name: ram

schema.description: filters based on RAM MB if exists

parameters.description: filters based on disk GB if exists
parameters.name: disk

schema.description: filters based on disk GB if exists

parameters.description: show flavors suited for the specific type of dedicated server
parameters.name: server_type

schema.description: show flavors suited for the specific type of dedicated server

parameters.description: show flavors suited for the specific dedicated server based on remaining resources
parameters.name: server_id

schema.description: show flavors suited for the specific dedicated server based on remaining resources

get.description: Returns a specific plan based on its code

post.description: Returns a specific plan by calculating entered cpu, ram and disk
Returns a specific plan by calculating disk

get.description: Returns all user's snapshots

post.description: Creates an image as a `Personal OS` from snapshot. Note this method is deprecated, use `Volumes/CreateOSVolumeFromSnapshot`

put.description: Reverts a volume or server to its snapshot

parameters.description: server or volume id which the snapshot belongs to
parameters.name: id

schema.description: server or volume id which the snapshot belongs to

post.description: Creates a volume from snapshot
Creates a snapshot from server

parameters.description: info about the snapshot to be created
parameters.name: CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRequest

schema.description: info about the snapshot to be created

post.description: Creates a snapshot from volume

parameters.description: info about the snapshot to be created
parameters.name: CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRequest

schema.description: info about the snapshot to be created

get.description: Reverts a volume or server to its snapshot

post.description: Creates a SSH key on the specified region

parameters.description: info about the new SSH key to be created
parameters.name: CreateSSHKeyRequest

schema.description: info about the new SSH key to be created

500.description: provided public key format is invalid

get.description: Returns a SSH key based on its name

post.description: Deletes a SSH key based on its name
Creates a private network

parameters.description: info about new private network to be created
parameters.name: CreatePrivateNetworkRequest

schema.description: info about new private network to be created

400.description: invalid data provided, it can be due to invalid subnet address, invalid gateway address, or bad dns

parameters.description: id and info of the private network to be updated
parameters.name: UpdatePrivateNetworkRequest

schema.description: id and info of the private network to be updated

400.description: invalid data provided, it can be due to invalid subnet address, invalid gateway address, or bad dns

get.description: Deletes a private network
Returns all user's tags

post.description: Add a new tag
Detaches a tag from its attached instance
Tags multiple instances in batch mode

400.description: one or more tags are invalid

404.description: one or more resources not found

post.description: Allocates only one traffic package

parameters.description: the info about requested traffic package
parameters.name: AllocateTrafficPackageRequest

schema.description: the info about requested traffic package

404.description: one or more resource IDs are not found

get.description: Returns a list of all available packages along with their info
Returns a list of users traffic packages history along with their info
Lists all volumes

post.description: Creates a volume

parameters.description: info about new volume to be created
parameters.name: CreateVolumeRequest

schema.description: info about new volume to be created

400.description: invalid data, note that size can only be positive decimal and in GB

422.description: invalid data, note that size can only be positive decimal and in GB

put.description:
Reverts snapshot to a volume
NOTE: currently snapshot revert is not possible for volumes, this feature will be added soon
until then, you can create a new volume from snapshot and use it.

patch.description: Attach a volume to an instance

parameters.description: volume and instance id for attachment
parameters.name: VolumeAttachDetachRequest

schema.description: volume and instance id for attachment

400.description: invalid data provided. either server or volume state is invalid for this operation

patch.description: Attach a volume to an instance

parameters.description: volume and instance id for attachment
parameters.name: VolumeAttachDetachRequest

schema.description: volume and instance id for attachment

404.description: volume attachment not found. this means the volume is not attached to this server

get.description: Attach a volume to an instance
Returns available options for a volume
Lists all OS Volumes, These volumes are bootable volumes which can be used to create an instance from a snapshot
Returns snapshots taken from user's volumes

post.description: Create a volume from specified snapshot
Creates an OS Volume from snapshot, which can later be used to boot up a new instance from that volume

400.description: provided data is invalid, or source disk is not bootable

instance_type.description: describes the type of resource, values: `server`, `network`, `image`, `volume`, `float_ip`, `security_group`

ether_type.description: IP Protocol type for the rule, either `ipv4` or `ipv6`

backup_id.description: Create instance from a backup, given its ID

backup_name.description: The name of the schedulded backups

enable_backup.description: Enable schedulded backup for the created instance

size.description: size of the disk in GB

instance_type.description: describes the type of resource, values: `server`, `network`, `image`, `volume`, `float_ip`, `security_group`

name.description: The name of the rescue image

allocation_pools.description:
Sub-ranges of CIDR available for dynamic allocation to ports.
See AllocationPool.

cidr.description: CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP version.

dns_nameservers.description: DNS name servers used by hosts in this subnet.

enable_dhcp.description: Specifies whether DHCP is enabled for this subnet or not.

gateway_ip.description: Default gateway used by devices in this subnet.

host_routes.description:
Routes that should be used by devices with IPs from this subnet
(not including local subnet route).

ipv6_address_mode.description: The IPv6 address modes specifies mechanisms for assigning IPv6 IP addresses.

ipv6_ra_mode.description:
The IPv6 router advertisement specifies whether the networking service
should transmit ICMPv6 packets.

name.description: Human-readable name for the subnet. Might not be unique.

project_id.description: ProjectID is the project owner of the subnet.

subnetpool_id.description: SubnetPoolID is the id of the subnet pool associated with the subnet.

tenant_id.description: TenantID is the project owner of the subnet.

key.description: An API key that is aqquired from MachineUser menu in ArvanCloud's panel
key.name: Apikey
